content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: USUBJID
      operator: non_empty
    - name: USUBJID
      operator: is_not_contained_by
      value: $dm_usubjid
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.109
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Trigger error when USUBJID is not present in DM in DM.USUBJID
Operations:
  - domain: DM
    id: $dm_usubjid
    name: USUBJID
    operator: distinct
Outcome:
  Message: USUBJID is not found in DM.USUBJID
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '109'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: To identify a subject uniquely across a submission,
                  a unique identifier (USUBJID) should be signed and included in all
                  subject-related datasets in the submission.
                Document: IG v3.1
                Section: 5.5.5.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Trigger error when USUBJID is not present in DM in DM.USUBJID

Outcome.Message: USUBJID is not found in DM.USUBJID

Citations.Cited_Guidance: To identify a subject uniquely across a submission, a unique identifier (USUBJID) should be signed and included in all subject-related datasets in the submission.
